data.title: Stat Allocator
data.solution:
class_name = input()
stat_order = input().split()

stats={}

n = int(input())

points = []
for i in range(n):
    p = int(input())
    points.append(p)

points.sort(reverse=True)

for i in range(4):
    p=0
    if i<len(points):
        p=points[i]
    stats[stat_order[i]]=p

print(class_name,stats["HP"],stats["ATK"],stats["DEF"],stats["SPD"])

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You have started a new game. Before you can start, you must choose a Class for your character and assign Points to each of your Stats. There are four stats: HP, ATK, DEF, SPD.

You will be given N integer values, along with your class's optimal stat order. You must assign one of the values to each stat. Each class has an optimal order for assigning points to stats. Assign the largest values to the highest priority stats. If there are not enough values for all stats, you have to put 0 for the remaining stats.

Output the class name, then your point allocations for your class in this order: HP, ATK, DEF, SPD.
Input
Line 1: The class name
Line 2: the 4 stats in their optimal order from Highest Priority to Least, separated by spaces
Line 3: N, the number of point values to follow.
Next N lines: A non-negative integer that can be assigned to stats.
Output
Line 1: The class name, then the 4 integers, all separated by spaces, representing the point allocations for each of the four stats: HP, ATK, DEF, SPD, in that order.
Constraints
The 4 stats will only be HP, ATK, DEF, and SPD in varying order.
N will always be a non-negative integer.
The point values given will all be non-negative integers.
Example
Input
Scout
SPD HP ATK DEF
4
1
2
3
4
Output
Scout 3 2 1 4
